problem.markdown:
>>I’ve designed a column with a solid square cross-section. If I then switch to a hollow, tube cross-section how will the allowable load be affected? Note: the outside dimensions or width will not change, so the cross-sectional area of the column will be reduced.<<
(x) The allowable load will decrease ( )The allowable load will increase ( )The allowable load will remain the same
[explanation] The load will decrease since by switching to a hollow cross-section with the same width you’ve reduced the cross-sectional area and moment of inertia. [explanation]
